intro: Dissotis cornifolia, commonly known as the swordleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in wetlands or along riverbanks, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom throughout the wet season. Dissotis cornifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
